channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 情報筋：iHeartの100名からなるポッドキャスト・ユニットのライターたちは、5月末までに契約合意に至らなければストライキを準備中、彼らは2年以上前に組合化（Katie Campione/Deadline）
item.description:
Katie Campione / Deadline:
Sources: writers at iHeart's 100-member podcast unit prepare to strike if a contract deal isn't reached by the end of May; they unionized 2+ years ago  —  EXCLUSIVE: More than two years after unionizing through the WGA East, the writers at iHeartPodcasts still don't have their first deal with the network.

item.title: ソースネルソン・ペルツ氏がディズニー株を全額売却、4月にはペルツ氏のトライアン・パートナーズがペルツ氏とジェイ・ラスロ氏を取締役に選ぼうとして委任状争奪戦に敗れる（CNBC）。
item.description:
CNBC:
Source: Nelson Peltz has sold his full Disney stake; in April, Peltz' Trian Partners lost a proxy battle after trying to elect Peltz and Jay Rasulo to the board  —  Activist investor Nelson Peltz has sold his entire stake in Disney, according to a person familiar with the matter.

item.title: Netflixは、「The Voice」に似た新しい音楽コンペティション番組を開発中で、ブランドセーフで家族向けのコンテンツで番組の幅を広げている（Jessica Toonkel/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Jessica Toonkel / Wall Street Journal:
Netflix is developing new music-competition shows similar to The Voice as it expands the breadth of its programming with brand-safe, family-friendly content  —  Netflix is ready to jam.  The streaming giant is developing new music-competition shows in the image of long-running broadcast hits like …

item.title: 研究者：ロシアに亡命した元フロリダ州保安官代理が、米国、英国、フランスの報道機関を模倣した160以上のフェイクニュースサイトの拡大するネットワークの背後にいる（Steven Lee Myers/New York Times）。
item.description:
Steven Lee Myers / New York Times:
Researchers: an ex-Florida deputy sheriff who received asylum in Russia is behind a growing network of 160+ fake news sites mimicking US, UK, and French outlets  —  In 2016, Russia used an army of trolls to interfere in the U.S. presidential election.  This year, an American given asylum …

item.title: アップルがアンドロイド向けTV・スポーツアプリの開発に携わるシニア・エンジニアを募集しているのは、同社のTV+サービスをライバル・プラットフォームにも導入しようとしていることの表れだ（Mark Gurman/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Mark Gurman / Bloomberg:
Apple is seeking a senior engineer to help build a TV and sports app for Android, a sign the company is bringing its TV+ service to the rival platform  —  - Company is seeking Android engineer to help build new app  — It's rare for Apple to develop software for rival platform

item.title: WBDが来季以降のNBA放映権を確保できなかったため、1989年にスタートし、2000年にチャールズ・バークレーを起用したTNTの『Inside the NBA』の今後について（Tania Ganguli/New York Times）
item.description:
Tania Ganguli / New York Times:
A look at the future of TNT's Inside the NBA, which started in 1989 and hired Charles Barkley in 2000, after WBD did not secure NBA rights beyond next season  —  Next season could be the last for TNT's influential and beloved studio show, and Charles Barkley, for one, will not be going quietly.

item.title: ソニー、Naughty Dog StudioのNeil Druckmann氏のインタビューを削除、彼がソニーの編集が示唆するようにAIツールを賞賛していないことを示す記録を投稿したため（Kyle Orland/Ars Technica）
item.description:
Kyle Orland / Ars Technica:
Sony takes down an interview with Naughty Dog Studio's Neil Druckmann after he posted a transcript showing that he didn't laud AI tools as Sony's edit implied  —  Move comes after Druckmann publicly disavowed some quotes: “This is not quite what I said.”  —  Sony has taken down an interview …

item.title: WAN-IFRAとOpenAIが提携し、128のニュースパブリッシャー向けにアクセラレータープログラムを開始、ニュースルームのAI導入の迅速化などを目指す（Vincent Peyrègne/WAN-IFRA）
item.description:
Vincent Peyrègne / WAN-IFRA:
WAN-IFRA and OpenAI partner to launch an accelerator program for 128 news publishers, aiming to help newsrooms fast-track their AI adoption and more  —  The era of AI, and especially generative AI, brings significant opportunities for newsrooms and publishers: AI can assist in creating …

item.title: 情報筋ソニー、クイーンの音楽カタログとマーチャンダイジング、その他の事業を買収するため、別の投資家と協力中。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
Sources: Sony is working with another investor to buy Queen's music catalog, including merchandising and other businesses, in a deal potentially worth ~$1B  —  - The talks are ongoing and may not result in a deal for songs  — Sony Music in talks with another investor about the purchase

item.title: Elleがマイアミで初のブランド・レジデンスを計画、フランスの出版社Lagardère Newsらと共同で180戸の25階建てタワーを建設（Abby Montanez/Robb Report）
item.description:
Abby Montanez / Robb Report:
Elle plans its first branded residences in Miami, with a 25-story tower featuring 180 units built in partnership with French publisher Lagardère News and others  —  The 25-story tower will feature 180 turnkey homes ranging from one-bedroom units to penthouses.

item.title: The AtlanticとVox MediaがOpenAIと複数年のライセンスおよび製品契約を締結、The AtlanticはOpenAIの技術を使った実験的なAtlantic Labsを計画（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
The Atlantic and Vox Media sign multi-year licensing and product deals with OpenAI; The Atlantic plans an experimental Atlantic Labs with OpenAI tech  —  - The Atlantic has been publishing content since 1857. … - Both agreements also allow OpenAI to tap into the respective publishers' current content …

item.title: BBCは、テレビ、ラジオ、オンラインコンテンツなど、英国内のグループやコミュニティをいかに正確かつ真正に表現しているかについてのレビューを開始した（Lily Ford/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Lily Ford / The Hollywood Reporter:
The BBC launches a review into how accurately and authentically it represents groups and communities across the UK, across TV, radio, online content, and more  —  The U.K. public broadcaster's review, led by former BAFTA chair Anne Morison and independent media consultant Chris Banatvala, will cover TV, radio, online content, and more.

item.title: 事実上の拒否権を持つBuzzFeed株の特別クラスを所有するジョナ・ペレッティは、ヴィヴェック・ラマスワミのいくつかの要求を「誤解」と称して拒否した（Benjamin Mullin/New York Times）。
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
Jonah Peretti, who owns a special class of BuzzFeed stock with an effective veto, rejects some of Vivek Ramaswamy's requests, calling them “misunderstandings”  —  The former G.O.P. presidential candidate, who has invested in BuzzFeed, believes the company needs to pivot.

item.title: Spotify、フランスでのPremiumサブスクリプションを0.13ユーロ増の11.12ユーロに、2023年初頭に同国が課す1.2％の音楽ストリーミング課税に合わせる（Paul Sawers/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Paul Sawers / TechCrunch:
Spotify hikes its Premium subscription in France by €0.13 to €11.12, to match the 1.2% music-streaming levy imposed by the country at the start of 2023  —  Spotify has hiked the price for its premium subscription in France by an eye-watering €0.13 in response …

item.title: ロンドン・イブニング・スタンダード紙が日刊紙を廃刊し週刊誌を創刊する計画、6年間で8,450万ポンドの赤字、地下鉄のWi-Fi増設などが原因（Jim Waterson/The Guardian）
item.description:
Jim Waterson / The Guardian:
London Evening Standard plans to close its daily paper and launch a weekly, citing £84.5M losses in six years, driven by the Underground adding Wi-Fi and more  —  Chair Paul Kanareck says newspaper's losses - £84.5m in the past six years - not sustainable
